alert.note: Alert for Blount; Jefferson; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 12:14PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Walker, southwestern Blount and north central Jefferson Counties through 100 PM CDT... At 1214 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sipsey, or 7 miles north of Sumiton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sumiton, Cordova, Dora, Adamsville, Warrior, Kimberly, Graysville, Brookside, Sipsey, Cardiff, Smith Dam, Rocky Hollow, Burnwell, Blount Springs, Beloit, Arkadelphia, Lynns Park, Smith Lake, Sayre and Empire. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
